alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 01 at 3:23PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, including the Skokomish River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A storm system will move into the area Thursday night bringing moderate to heavy rain through Saturday morning. Three to five inches of rain are expected over the southwest Olympics with snow levels in the 7000 to 8000 feet range. This will likely drive the Skokomish River above flood stage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
